definition: Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to vomit/to throw up
grain/corn
valley
surname Gu
muddy/to mix

sentences.english: A'cai, chief of Tu Gu Hun, had 20 sons.
sentences.chinese: 吐谷浑的首领阿豺有二十个儿子。

sentences.english: First of all, from a strategically advantageous position in the history of Tuyuhun summarized.
sentences.chinese: 首先高屋建瓴地对吐谷浑的历史沿革进行了概述。

sentences.english: Second, in the Western Regions of Tuguhun longitudinal expansion on the situation.
sentences.chinese: 其次对吐谷浑在西域的拓展情况进行纵向论述。

definition: Turkic ethnic group
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
ancient Central Asian city state, flourished in first millennium AD, in modern Aksu 阿克蘇地區|阿克苏地区, Xinjiang
Qarluq or Karluk nomadic tribe, a Turkic ethnic minority in ancient times
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)
Nanzhao kingdom 738-937 in southwest China and southeast Asia
khanate (Mongol state)
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
